title: Dow Jones Shows Backbone As Sellers Smack The Nasdaq; S&P 500 Tests This Key Technical Level
text: Dollar-based turnover, according to IBD research, grew more than 7% to roughly $265 billion. That hints at some serious profit-taking.

title: Putting A Bow On Inflation Concerns; Rates Rising, Stocks Worried?; Fed Is Key - Market Strategy Weekly - February 19, 2021
text: Though we spent a good amount of time last week on inflation, we figured we'd start there again to put a bow on our thoughts. While we may experience an “inflation scare” this year as consumer demand is unleashed fully, we are not yet overly concerned.

title: Stocks: We could see substantial growth in the coming quarters: Tom Essaye
text: Tom Essaye, Sevens Report Research founder and president, joins Yahoo Finance's Alexis Christoforous to discuss the rise in yields, concerns over inflation and the outlook for markets. title: Market Recap: Monday, February 22: S&P 500 extends losing streak to 5 straight sessions
text: Stocks ended Monday's session mixed while commodity prices rallied, as rising Treasury yields and expectations of higher inflation weighed on equity prices. Tech shares sold off, and the Nasdaq posted its biggest drop in a month.

title: The Size Of Biden's Fiscal Package
text: Is there some justification for fears on the part of some that the fiscal package sent to Congress by the Biden government carries the risk of bringing too much stimulus? According to Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, it would be better to run the risk of excess than insufficiency.

title: Jim Cramer: Not too late to make a big bet on these reopening stocks
text: "You're no longer early with these names, but that doesn't mean you're late either," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Jim Cramer breaks down how to play the market rotation as recovery optimism grows
text: "It is not too late to make a big bet on the reopening stocks, but remember to sock away a couple of the better growth names on the way down," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Jim Cramer reveals reopening stocks that investors can play amid rotation
text: "It is not too late to make a big bet on the reopening stocks, but remember to sock away a couple of the better growth names on the way down," the "Mad Monye" host said.

title: Higher yields leading to a great opportunity, according to BTIG's Julian Emanuel
text: Julian Emanuel, BTIG chief equity strategist, joins CNBC's "Fast Money" to discuss rising interest rates and whether the trend could derail Big Tech's big rally.

title: As Volatility Fades, Can Cyclicals Shine?
text: Even after fading from the late January peak, the VIX Index ended the month 45% above where it started. That jump represents the largest month-over-month increase since the fall of 2018. Technical dislocations may continue to cause short-term disruptions, but two factors favor a further drop in equity volatility: an improving economy and exceptionally easy monetary conditions.

title: How the Federal Reserve is at risk of politicization
text: Former Federal Reserve governor Larry Lindsey weighs in on 'FOX Business Tonight.'

title: What Vaccine Progress Means For Stock Markets
text: The development of multiple COVID-19 vaccines cheered markets late last year, with efficacy levels that exceeded expectations. Restrictions could ease slightly later in Europe given some problems with vaccine production.

title: Market bull Julian Emanuel sees rising Treasury yields accelerating a major leadership change. Here's how to play it.
text: While rising Treasury yields create jitters on Wall Street, BTIG's Julian Emanuel is looking to put money to work outside of Big Tech.

title: Being Creative And Maneuvering Through Politics In A Low Yield Era
text: Being on the path to recovery for 2021 means accounting for risks and pushing through tricky areas. In the global market outlook from T.

title: How Much Is Too Much?
text: Despite strong signs of improvement, the U.S. government is acting as though the economy is still in a similar deep freeze. Goldman Sachs estimates that U.S. households have accumulated some $1.5 trillion in excess savings over the past year.

title: Russell 2000 Leads The EPS Upgrade Cycle
text: The EPS recovery outlook continues to brighten globally, with forecasts for most markets and sectors enjoying a fresh round of upgrades in recent months. The US small-cap Russell 2000 remains the recovery pacesetter, with EPS now expected to more than triple year-over-year this year (owing much to base effects), and to advance at a 36% pace in 2022.

title: Monday Told a Tale of 2 Stock Markets
text: Big winners and losers on the same day could start a trend.

title: Bill Miller Q4 2020 Market Letter
text: I have noted before that just understanding what is going on now is preferable to trying to guess what will happen in the unknown future. So far, the Fed's liquidity provisioning via bond purchases and increasing the money supply have resulted in higher stock prices but not significantly higher inflation expectations.

title: The Dow Rose 27 Points Because Value Stocks Won Out Again
text: Big Tech's banner names Apple and Microsoft saw shares slump as interest rates continued to rise. The Nasdaq Composite tumbled 2.5%.

title: NewsWatch: Can the bull market in stocks survive rising inflation, bond yields? Here's what history says
text: Rising bond yields are sending shivers through the stock market. Here's a sector-by-sector breakdown of what history says about a rising rate environment.

title: Stock Market Today: Tech Throttled as Treasury Yields Continue Climb
text: Nosebleed valuations in the technology sector cooled off Monday amid a brutal day for Nasdaq longs. The Dow, meanwhile, clawed out modest gains.

title: There will be robust growth in 2021: BofA's Michelle Meyer
text: Bank of America projects GDP growth to be 6.5 percent in 2021 and 5 percent in 2022. Michelle Meyer, Bank of America global research head of U.S. economics, says continued progress on vaccination efforts and further stimulus is likely to push the U.S. for growth.

title: Wall Street ends mixed as Dow picks up big tech slack
text: 4:15pm: S&P clinches sixth straight losing day The DJIA lost ground over the course of the afternoon but managed to eke out a positive finish despite an early 200-point deficit. The blue-chip index closed up 27 points, less than 0.1%, at 31,522.

title: As bond yields rise, tech falls down: Citi's Tobias Levkovich
text: Tobias Levkovich, Citi chief U.S. equity strategist, says tech small caps have been down since September 2020. As bond yields rise, it's not surprising tech is going down, he says.

title: Tech shares drag Nasdaq sharply lower as Dow ekes out a positive finish
text: Tech-related shares sank Monday, dragging the Nasdaq Composite to a sharply lower finish and weighing on the S&P 500, while the more cyclically oriented Dow Jones Industrial Average finished in positive territory. Rising bond yields were blamed for pressure on more growth-oriented sectors, highlighting concerns about stretched valuations, as investors prepare for stronger economic growth on hopes vaccine rollouts and significant fiscal stimulus will boost growth.

title: Tech stocks tumble as investors balk at lofty valuations
text: US stocks were mixed on Monday with tech stocks pulling back over valuation concerns while investors weighed what rising yields could mean for inflation. Fundstrat's Thomas Lee says the case for cyclical stocks within energy, industrials, consumer discretionary, materials, and financials is strengthening as coronavirus cases fall and the US economy begins to re-open.

title: Senate panel to hold nomination hearings for SEC, CFPB heads on March 2
text: The Senate Committee on Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs announced Monday that it will hold nomination hearings for President Joe Biden's picks to lead the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau on March 2 at 10 a.m. Eastern Time.

title: Janet Yellen reiterates call for large stimulus package
text: Yahoo Finance's Brian Cheung weighs in on Secretary of Treasury Janet Yellen comments on the need to stimulus the economy. Also, Brian weighs in on the upcoming testimony of Fed Chair Jerome Powell on Capitol Hill regarding monetary policy.

title: Treasury Yields Are Soaring As Economic Recovery Becomes Reality, But That May Be A Bad Thing
text: All eyes will be on Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell this week.

title: Rising rates only has moderate cooling effect on housing: Black Knight's Andy Walden
text: CNBC's Becky Quick discusses how rising mortgage rates may impact the housing markets with Andy Walden of Black Knight. title: China asks the United States to remove sanctions
text: Yahoo Finance's Aikiko Fujita and Zack Guzman report on China calling on the United States to lift the tariffs on Chinese goods.

title: 10-year Treasury yield nears highest in a year as recovery prospects strengthen
text: The 10-year Treasury yield pushed close to its highest level in a year on Monday, as the outlook for economic recovery prompted investors to continue selling bonds and search for higher-yielding assets. The yield hit 1.352%, just shy of a 12-month high of 1.374% logged on Feb. 24, 2020.

title: CNBC Rapid Update shows strong growth forecast for 2021
text: CNBC's Steve Liesman reports on the 2021 growth forecast, according to CNBC's Rapid Update. He also discusses the contributing factors.

title: The best-performing stocks of 2021 so far: small companies
text: The best-performing stocks of 2021 are those belonging to smaller companies, according to The Wall Street Journal. In fact, small companies are outpacing large ones at the widest margin in more than 20 years.

title: Economic Report: U.S. economy set to speed up, leading index signals
text: The U.S. economy is still growing and likely to speed up in the first six months of 2021, a new survey suggests.

title: Back From The Frozen Houston Landscape (Technically Speaking For 2/22)
text: The latest Federal Reserve Minutes show an economy that is in fair shape, but with some concerning weaknesses.

title: U.K. Service Sector Downturn Eases In February But Manufacturing Woes Deepen
text: Flash UK composite PMI rises to 49.8 in February.

title: Momentum is building for a stock-trading tax — and Wall Street is furious
text: Uncle Sam is in search for a pot of gold that could ease the pain of trillion-dollar deficits. And some believe Wall Street might just have the answer.

title: Investors need to keep an eye on bond yields: Bokeh Capital's Forrest
text: CNBC's Becky Quick discusses markets as bond yields rise with Kim Forrest of Bokeh Capital Partners and David Wagner of Aptus Capital Advisors.

title: Commodities Were A Rare Bright Spot Last Week
text: Commodities and foreign junk bonds were the only winners last week for the major asset classes, based on a set of exchange traded funds.

title: The Only Reason To Be 'Bearish' Is 'No One Is Bearish'
text: More than 90% of investors believe the economy will be more robust in 2021, with a consensus it's a V-shape recovery.

title: In One Chart: ‘Excessive stimulus' puts value stocks on track to outperform growth over next 4 years, says Stifel's Bannister
text: There's limited upside for the S&P 500, but value stocks could solidly outpace growth over the next four years as “excessive stimulus” works its way through the financial system, says a veteran Wall Street strategist.

title: Debt, Inflation, And Markets - Weekly Blog # 669
text: Debt is a major accelerator of most economic collapses, distinct from those primarily caused by political, medical, or climate changes. Rising stock markets have a habit of lasting longer than when structural problems are present, staying "bullish" until something changes mass opinion.

title: J.P. Morgan's Dubravko Lakos: State of consumer remains strong
text: Dubravko Lakos, head of U.S. equity strategy and global quantitative research at J.P. Morgan, joins CNBC's "Halftime Report" to discuss the themes he's watching in 2021 amid global reopening.

title: World's top 10 hedge fund managers earn $20.1 billion in 2020
text: Millennium Management's Israel Englander earned $3.8 billion last year, landing him the biggest payday of any hedge fund manager in 2020, showed data from Institutional Investor.

title: Market nervousness growing over Powell's testimony to Congress this week
text: Rising bond yields and accompanying inflation fears are adding a level of drama to Powell's appearance.

title: Market Extra: Climbing bond yields globally put central banks ‘in a bind,' warns economist
text: The escalating rise in longer-term government bond yields around the world could threatening to undermine efforts by central banks to support the global recovery.

title: Weekly Market Pulse - Real Rates Finally Make A Move
text: The big news of the week was the spike in interest rates, which according to the press reports I read, "came out of nowhere". Last week's economic reports were mostly positive and better than expected.

title: S&P 500 falls for a fifth straight day amid rate fears
text: CNBC's "Halftime Report" team discusses the outlook for the stock market and what names they're selling and buying.

title: Why Top Economists Are Citing a Higher-Than-Reported Jobless Rate
text: The official rate stood at 6.3% in January, but using an expanded metric, Fed and Treasury officials say it's closer to 10%.
